results.justification: The document explicitly states the methodology, describing two studies with specific designs and hypotheses. (e.g., 'In preparation for Study 1...' and 'In light of the surprising findings in Study 1...')
Both Study 1 and Study 2 have detailed 'Procedure' sections outlining the steps taken, from participant recruitment to data collection. (e.g., '3.2 Procedure' and '4.2 Experimental Manipulation')
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only=58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b'.
The document describes the variables measured (e.g., '3.4 Measures') and provides details about the scales used. Demographic information is also detailed.
The document details how participants were recruited (Prolific), compensated ($1.70/$2.00), and the survey format (10-minute survey). (e.g., '3.1 Participants' and '4.1 Participants')
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only=58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b'.

The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only=58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b.', implying scripts for data cleaning and analysis are included.

The document describes statistical tests (linear regression, Pearson’s r), effect sizes (e.g., 0.25), confidence intervals, and p-values. (e.g., '3.5.1 Effects of Explanations on Preference and Attitudes' and '3.5.2 Relationship Between Attitudes and Preferences')
The document describes a thematic analysis of open-ended responses from participants, detailing the coding process and identified themes. (e.g., '4.5.2 Exploratory Measures')
The document states: 'The study was preregistered on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'
The document clearly presents the results of both studies, including statistical findings and interpretations. (e.g., '3.5 Results' and '4.5 Results')
The document discusses limitations, such as the use of Prolific participants and the context of ITS, and potential biases. (e.g., '5.3 Limitations and Future Research')
